description: Cancels active runs for a flow. You can cancel all of the active runs for a flow, or you can cancel specific runs by providing their IDs. You can cancel a flow run only when the run is in progress. You can't cancel a run that has already completed or failed. You also can't cancel a run that's scheduled to occur but hasn't started yet. To prevent a scheduled run, you can deactivate the flow with the StopFlow action. You cannot resume a run after you cancel it. When you send your request, the status for each run becomes CancelStarted. When the cancellation completes, the status becomes Canceled.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: The name of a flow with active runs that you want to cancel.

parameters.name: executionIds
parameters.description: The ID of each active run to cancel. These runs must belong to the flow you specify in your request. If you omit this parameter, your request ends all active runs that belong to the flow. (string) ---

nested_items.name: invalidExecutions
nested_items.description: The IDs of runs that Amazon AppFlow couldn't cancel. These runs might be ineligible for canceling because they haven't started yet or have already completed.
